password_security_best_practices.description: Create passwords that are at least 12 characters long and include a mix of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters.
Do not use easily guessable information like 'password', '123456', or your name/birthday.

password_security_best_practices.practice: Use a unique password for each account
password_security_best_practices.description: Never reuse passwords across multiple sites or services to minimize the risk if one account is compromised.
Add an extra layer of security by requiring a second form of verification, such as a text message or authentication app.
Update passwords periodically, especially for sensitive accounts or after a security breach.
Store and manage complex passwords securely with a reputable password manager.

password_security_best_practices.practice: Avoid saving passwords in your browser
password_security_best_practices.description: Browser-stored passwords can be vulnerable to malware and unauthorized access.

password_security_best_practices.practice: Be cautious with password reset options
password_security_best_practices.description: Ensure your recovery email and security questions are secure and not easily guessable.
Regularly check for unusual logins or activity and update your password immediately if anything seems off.
Be aware of and avoid phishing scams that trick you into revealing your password.

password_security_best_practices.practice: Use passphrases instead of single words
password_security_best_practices.description: Create passwords using a sequence of words or a sentence that's easy to remember but hard to guess.
Do not include personal details like your name, birthdate, or address in your passwords.
Refrain from using common dictionary words that can be easily cracked by password-guessing tools.

password_security_best_practices.practice: Include a mix of character types
password_security_best_practices.description: Use a combination of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and special symbols.
Do not use sequences like '1234' or 'abcd' in your passwords.
Refrain from using repeated characters like 'aaaa' or '1111'.
Generate passwords with random combinations of characters to increase complexity.
Avoid writing passwords on paper or storing them in unsecured digital files.
Keep your passwords confidential and do not share them with others.

password_security_best_practices.practice: Use different passwords for work and personal accounts
password_security_best_practices.description: Separate your professional and personal digital identities by using distinct passwords.
Periodically review and update your passwords to maintain security.
Choose security questions and answers that are not easily guessable or publicly available.
Avoid logging into sensitive accounts over unsecured public Wi-Fi networks.
Always log out from accounts when you're done, especially on shared or public devices.
Enhance security by enabling fingerprint or facial recognition features.
Ensure your devices are protected with passwords or PINs to prevent unauthorized access.
Keep your operating systems and applications up to date to patch security vulnerabilities.
Do not click on suspicious links or provide credentials in response to unsolicited emails.
Ensure websites use HTTPS to secure data transmission.

password_security_best_practices.practice: Avoid using the same password across multiple accounts
password_security_best_practices.description: Using unique passwords for each account prevents a breach in one from compromising others.
Utilize tools to create strong, random passwords.
Do not use predictable patterns like 'qwerty' or 'asdfgh' in your passwords.
Use password strength checkers to evaluate the robustness of your passwords.
Ensure no one is watching when you enter your passwords in public places.
Protect your password manager with a strong master password and enable MFA.
Always change default passwords on devices and applications.

password_security_best_practices.practice: Avoid using the same password for multiple accounts
password_security_best_practices.description: Reusing passwords increases the risk of multiple accounts being compromised.
Maintain backups to recover information in case of a security breach.

password_security_best_practices.practice: Educate yourself on security best practices
password_security_best_practices.description: Stay informed about the latest security threats and how to protect against them.
Install antivirus and anti-malware programs to protect your devices.
Do not click on links from unknown or untrusted sources.
Do not open attachments from unknown senders.
Check your accounts for unauthorized access or unusual activity.
Ensure your password recovery options are secure and not easily guessable.
Limit the amount of personal information you share on social media platforms.

password_security_best_practices.practice: Use a VPN on public networks
password_security_best_practices.description: Utilize a Virtual Private Network (VPN) when accessing sensitive information over public Wi-Fi.
